intro: Ammannia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's ammannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered red or pink flowers. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and withstand drought. The genus Ammannia is part of the family Polygonaceae, which includes other plants with similar botanical traits.
